text: i'm scott gehring i am a solution
architect for amazon web services in
zurich my role as a solution architect
at aws
we're really there to help customers
solve their particular business problems
using the technology available on the
aws platform so that means not just
saying
you know go and use a database go and
use a virtual machine but really looking
and trying to understand the problems
they're trying to solve their existing
technology landscape and skill set
and
what we can recommend them to get them
from where they are to where they would
like to be
so i think the most exciting part of the
role at aws is variety of companies that
you get to work for you really have this
opportunity to see all these different
companies and all these different
industries doing all these different
things with different technologies and
it's a really good growth opportunity as
well teams really contribute to your
growth because you end up with such a
diverse mix of people with a diverse mix
of experience and because of this
breadth
and depth of
teammates you always have somebody you
can go to with some particular topic
that you're unfamiliar with yourself you
always have something you can learn from
from other people
outside of my role at work
in the essay team we have a lot of
adjacent responsibilities things that we
aren't explicitly expected to do but
it's nice if we do there's a few
companies locally that support coding
for girls and young women
so we did one workshop with a bunch of
girls between the ages of 10 and 13 and
we did it on machine learning and
text-to-speech and these sort of things
that are
really fairly specialized and it was
amazing to see
how advanced the girls already were
despite their young years i mean i
remember when i was that age and i
wasn't doing much fancy on the computer
and they already had their own websites
it's really cool and as part of the role
with aws you get to go out into the
community and see these sort of things
and try and
help push people forward with their
passions which i think is nice
[Music]
you
